page.title: 05ELDERLY PEOPLE IN ST JOHNS.
page.content: We are nationally aware of the growing elderly population.In that part of St Johns & Lower Wick within our survey block 13% of all adults are retired. The problems of old age are now recognised and practical help given.There are 2 modern council purpose built flat complexes for the elderly;1 housing association flat complex and 3 private nursing homes. The policy of helping the elderly to retain their independence in their own homes is organised by the Gereatirc Department of the local Health Centre.Here,health visitors,home helps & meals on wheels are organised.A booklet 'Services for the elderly in the City of Worcester' is available in which are listed problems likely to be experienced,along with services provided to solve them.Bus passes,at a low cost are available for pensioners.
